Crimes.Crime_Name: Failure to disclose family member in immigration application
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Whether failure to disclose a dependant bars sponsorship under the family class
Crimes.Governing_Law: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act (IRPA), Immigration and Refugee Protection Regulations (IRPR)
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Applicant knowingly omitted son, indicating lack of credibility
Crimes.Evidence_Type: Immigration application records, family relationship documentation
Crimes.Legal_Provision: Paragraph 117(9)(d) of IRPR, Section 65 of IRPA
Crimes.Basis_of_Claim: Sponsorship eligibility based on family class membership
Crimes.Evaluation_Standard: Reasonableness of IAD's interpretation and application of law
Crimes.Key_Factor_in_Determination: Deliberate omission of dependent in initial application
Crimes.Proceeding_Type: Administrative appeal followed by judicial review
Crimes.Application_Error: Failure to declare son as dependant
Crimes.Evidence_Ignored: None – all evidence considered consistent with statutory bar
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Interpretation of family class eligibility under IRPR
Crimes.Application_Factor: Omission of immediate family member during permanent residence application
Crimes.Decision_Outcome: Son not eligible under family class due to non-disclosure
Crimes.Authority: Minister of Immigration, Refugees and Citizenship
Crimes.Decision_Review_Issue: Legality and reasonableness of IAD’s decision
Crimes.Cause_of_Refusal: Applicant failed to disclose her son in her initial immigration application
Crimes.Legal_Provision_Cited: Section 65 of IRPA, Paragraph 117(9)(d) of IRPR
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issues: Undisputed that son was not disclosed
Crimes.Document_Fraud: Not applicable – omission rather than falsification
Crimes.Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Charter arguments and international conventions raised but rejected
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Limitation on humanitarian and compassionate consideration under section 65
Crimes.Grounds_for_Inadmissibility: Ineligibility under family class due to non-disclosure

Crimes.Legal_Issue: Whether misrepresentation disqualifies sponsorship and violates Charter or international rights
Crimes.Governing_Law: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act (IRPA), Immigration and Refugee Protection Regulations (IRPR)
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Applicant made a deliberate choice to misrepresent family status
Crimes.Evidence_Type: Immigration application records, proof of parent-child relationship
Crimes.Legal_Provision: Section 65 of IRPA, Paragraph 117(9)(d) of IRPR
Crimes.Basis_of_Claim: Eligibility for sponsorship under family class despite prior misrepresentation
Crimes.Decision_Maker: Visa Officer and Immigration Appeal Division (IAD)
Crimes.Application_Error: Intentional non-disclosure of son as dependant
Crimes.Evidence_Ignored: None – evidence supported finding of misrepresentation
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Interpretation of family class exclusion due to misrepresentation
Crimes.Application_Factor: Prior failure to disclose immediate family member
Crimes.Decision_Outcome: Sponsorship barred under family class; H&C consideration excluded under s.65
Crimes.Authority: Minister of Immigration, Refugees and Citizenship
Crimes.Decision_Review_Issue: Validity of statutory interpretation and constitutional challenges
Crimes.Governing_Rule_or_Provision: Paragraph 117(9)(d) of IRPR, Section 65 of IRPA
Crimes.Cause_of_Refusal: Deliberate omission of son in immigration application
Crimes.Legal_Provision_Cited: Section 65 of IRPA, Paragraph 117(9)(d) of IRPR
Crimes.Document_Fraud: Not applicable – no forged documents, but false statement by omission
Crimes.Credibility_Issues: Serious credibility concerns due to intentional misrepresentation
Crimes.Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Charter rights and international human rights conventions invoked but rejected
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Exclusion of humanitarian and compassionate assessment due to statutory bar
Crimes.Grounds_for_Inadmissibility: Ineligibility for family class sponsorship due to misrepresentation
